Cuban Diplomats Visit Museum 
    Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- Ruben Perez Valdes, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the embassy visited the museum of gifts of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on Wednesday on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the visit to the DPRK by Fidel Castro Ruz, the supreme leader of the Cuban revolution.
 They looked round with keen interest the gifts reflecting the unbounded reverence of the servicepersons of the Korean People's Army for President Kim Il Sung who founded the revolutionary armed forces of Juche type and developed it to be invincible ranks of the vanguard and Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il who has exalted the dignity and might of Juche Korea with his unique Songun revolutionary leadership.
 The ambassador said that their visit to the museum provided them with an opportunity to know well about the ardent desire of the KPA servicepersons to convey the undying revolutionary exploits performed by the three generals of Mt. Paektu to posterity.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Bulgarian Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Angel Orbetsov, Bulgarian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
 Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, and staff members of the Bulgarian embassy were on hand.    
 After receiving the credentials, Kim Yong Nam had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: World-class Woman Gymnasts
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests including railway delegations of Russia, Mongolia, China, Vietnam and Kazakhstan participating in the meeting of Countries of the Asian Region of the Railway Cooperation Organization Thursday visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President        Kim Il Sung.
 They entered the hall where the President lies in state. They made bows in humble reverence to him who dedicated his whole life to the world peace and the cause of independence and development of friendly relations among countries.
 Then they looked round with deep interest orders and medals of the DPRK and different countries conferred upon the President and certificates of honorary titles he received from foreign countries, the mourners' hall and a train coach and a car he used during his on-the-spot guidance and foreign tour.    
They made entries in the visitor's book.

World-class Woman Gymnasts 
    Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- The International Gymnastics Federation decided to confer the honorary title "World-class Gymnast" on female gymnasts Kang Yun Mi of the Pyongyang City Sports Group and Pyon Kwang Sun of the Kigwancha Sports Group of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 Kang and Pyon were highly appreciated by experts and spectators for their high standard of technical movements displayed at the 37th World Gymnastics Championships, the Athens Olympic Games and other international gymnastics contests.    
 According to the decision, they were recently awarded the badges of the title.
